intro: Dendrophthora amoebandra, commonly known as the amoeba-like bracket fungus, is a unique species of fungus that exhibits a distinctive, gelatinous, and ameboid appearance. It belongs to the family Phyllachoraceae and is typically found growing on decaying wood in moist, temperate forest environments. The fungus has a soft, irregularly shaped cap that can change in size and form depending on environmental conditions. It plays an important ecological role in the decomposition of organic matter, contributing to nutrient cycling in forest ecosystems. Due to its unusual morphology, it is often mistaken for other fungal species or even non-fungal organisms.
